chineseMeaning: v. 降低 ... 的地位；降低 ... 的品格；贬低;
examples: The president is not willing to abase himself before the nation.

chineseMeaning: n. 撑杆；支撑; adj. 令人振奋的；提神的;  动词brace的现在分词.;
examples: Transverse bracing was installed between the two shafts.

chineseMeaning: adj. 古怪的；反常的；不同圆心的; n. 怪人；[物]偏心轮;
examples: The old lady is a bit of an eccentric.
She put him down as an eccentric person.
His actions since that morning have been eccentric and unpredictable.
The motors and drive units on these two types of polisher's oscillate in an eccentric circular motion.

chineseMeaning: adj. 促进基督教不同教派大联合的；世界范围的；普遍的;
n. 椭圆;
v. 畏缩；退缩；畏首畏尾; n. 退缩；逃避;
examples: Jane didn't flinch once when the doctor cleaned the cut in her arm.
Rex gently placed his armored hand on her shoulder, making her flinch from the cold hardness.
You mustn't flinch from a difficulty.

chineseMeaning: n. 调情的人；卖弄风骚的人; vi. 调情；玩弄；掠过；轻率对待; vt. 忽然弹出；摇动;
examples: They say he's a terrible flirt.
Is Kelly a flirt, who goes from boy to boy?
She'll be fixed as the silliest flirt who ever made her family ridiculous.

chineseMeaning: n. 一群；兽群；大堆；群众；羊群; v. 聚集；成群而行;
examples: There are many flocks of tourists in the palace.
A flock of sheep poured through the gate.
People came in flocks to see the royal procession.
A few sheep have been lost from the flock.

chineseMeaning: v. 满足地看；沾沾自喜；幸灾乐祸;
examples: Chinese leaders have another reason not to gloat over the KMT's victory.
Stop gloating just because you won the game!
It's nothing to gloat about.
I will not gloat over my enemies' predicatment before killing them.

chineseMeaning: n. 光彩；光泽；虚饰; n. 注释；注解; v. 掩盖；（使）有光泽; v. 作注释;
examples: The surface gloss had begun to crack.
Repair your face, shine your gloss!
With this polish you can give a good high gloss to the wood.
The gel gives your hair a gloss.
The gloss and glitter of Hollywood seemed fascinating to the girl.
The minister has put a different gloss on recent developments.
The single word gloss was usually interlined.
I couldn't understand the book without the gloss.

chineseMeaning: n. 供过于求；过量; v. 使充满；过量供应;
examples: The glut of fruit sent the prices down.
The glut of movie screens has also prompted the big chains to shutter their own historic theaters.
What's more, the glut of prohibitions is tantamount to treating the driver like a child and it also foments resentment.
What started out as a slight oversupply is turning into a full-blown supply glut which is sending shockwaves through the whole industry and which could take years to play out.

chineseMeaning: n. 耙; vt. 耙掘；伤害；使苦恼;
examples: The farmer's harrow was broken during his working.
I'll take the iron harrow to the field.
He is removing weeds with a harrow in the rice field.

chineseMeaning: adj. 要倒塌似的；摇摇欲坠的;
examples: These ramshackle buildings have fallen down.

chineseMeaning: v. 化脓；发炎；惹怒；使痛苦;
adj. 贪婪的；强夺的;
examples: Hawks and other rapacious birds prey on variety of small animals.
Mr Brown said there was also a global perspective to America's rapacious model of consumption.

chineseMeaning: n. 学者；专家;
examples: The hypothesis can explain various characters going with idiot savant.

chineseMeaning: v. 理解; n. 理解能力；悟性；常识; adj. 机智的；有常识的;
examples: Keep your mouth shut! Savvy?

chineseMeaning: adj. 不充分的；不足的; v. 减缩；限制；忽略;
examples: Your attachment to substandard lodgings and scant tuition in Dover is clearly irrational.

chineseMeaning: n. 分歧；分裂；分立；分派（教会）;
examples: The Chinese-American schism poses a dilemma for the next president.
I shouldn't exaggerate the schism.
If another schism like that happen again, they will wind up in bankruptcy.
In this way, a deep American schism was born.
We are much too apt to look at schism in our church as an unmitigated evil.

chineseMeaning: v. （使）蒸发;  =vaporise（英）;
examples: The heat from the water is used to vaporize a low-boiling liquid.
Particles moving at these speeds vaporize if they hit any other material.

chineseMeaning: n. 不一致；变化；[数]方差;
examples: We are at variance about our lodger.
Variance between transeunt request and self judgement.
This theory is at variance with the known facts.
I have felt the variance in temperature.
Analysis of variance was used for data analysis.

chineseMeaning: adj. 杂色的；斑驳的；形形色色的;  动词variegate的过去式和过去分词形式.;
examples: This specimen is richly variegated in colour.
We're going to grow a variegated ivy up the back of the house.
This plant has beautifully variegated leaves.

chineseMeaning: n. 窖；穹；地下室；撑竿跳; vt. 做成圆拱形；撑竿跳跃; vi. 跳跃;
examples: He was buried in the family vault.
In medieval times, poets often called the sky "the vault of heaven".
She put her jewels in a vault at the bank.
This underground vault is theftproof.
Our school won first place for the pole vault.
